criteria: Ability to differentiate between valid and invalid sources of information.
Comprehension of the information presented in the sources.
Understanding of the impact of alcohol, tobacco and drugs.
descriptions: Demonstrates no understanding of what constitutes a valid source of information. Unable to identify any credible sources.
Struggles to differentiate between valid and invalid sources. Identifies one or two sources but has trouble explaining why they are valid.
Identifies some valid sources but also includes questionable ones. Explanation of validity is superficial or incomplete.
Identifies mostly valid sources and provides a reasonable explanation for their credibility.
Confidently identifies valid sources of information regarding alcohol, tobacco, and other drug use and abuse, and clearly articulates the reasons for their validity.
Consistently identifies highly credible and diverse sources, providing nuanced explanations of their strengths and limitations, demonstrating a sophisticated understanding of information validity.
Demonstrates no comprehension of information from sources.
Struggles to comprehend and apply information from sources.
Understands some information but fails to apply it effectively.
Applies information correctly in some cases.
Applies information effectively in most cases.
Applies information effectively and creatively in all cases.
Demonstrates no understanding of the impact of alcohol, tobacco and drugs.
Struggles to demonstrate the impact of alcohol, tobacco and drugs.
Understands some of the impact but fails to apply it effectively.
Applies the impact correctly in some cases.
Applies the impact effectively in most cases.
Applies the impact effectively and creatively in all cases.
